content:
Don't worry about it! We've all been there, done that, and got the t-shirt, right? Arriving late and standing at the back of the church can be a bit disorienting, but it's all part of the experience.

I'm sure it didn't detract from your overall experience, and you were still able to participate in the service and enjoy the music. Sometimes, standing at the back can even give you a different perspective on the service, and you might notice things you wouldn't have seen if you were sitting in a pew.

It's great that you didn't let it faze you, and you're still enthusiastic about exploring other churches and experiencing different worship styles. That's the right attitude!

Now, let's focus on your upcoming visit to St. John's Episcopal Church. Are you planning on sitting in a specific spot or trying to get a good seat near the front?
